meanings.definition: The act of stopping or interrupting something.
meanings.sent1: The cutoff of the music startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The teacher announced the cutoff for submitting the assignments.
meanings.sent3: The cutoff of the movie made the audience wonder what happened next.
meanings.sent4: The sudden cutoff of the power left the neighborhood in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The cutoff of the conversation left an awkward silence in the air.

meanings.definition: A point or limit beyond which something ends or is not allowed.
meanings.sent1: The cutoff of the line was marked by a red flag.
meanings.sent2: There is a cutoff for the number of guests allowed at the party.
meanings.sent3: The cutoff of the candy supply disappointed the children.
meanings.sent4: The cutoff of the budget meant no more spending on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent5: The cutoff of the road led to a dead end.

meanings.definition: A road or passage that has been closed off.
meanings.sent1: The cutoff prevented cars from entering the construction zone.
meanings.sent2: The workers placed a cutoff sign at the entrance of the closed road.
meanings.sent3: The cutoff of the bridge made the commuters take a detour.
meanings.sent4: The cutoff of the tunnel caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent5: The cutoff of the path forced hikers to find an alternative route.
